column5: Newest Post is Up  Its another Algonquin report with a twist - I wasn't able to make it! Thankfully my brother (and the group) stepped up to the plate and pulled together a report They headed into Algonquin for 2 nights - Happy Ilse and Merchant Lake via the Opeongo shuttle All in all they had a great time, caught some fish, tried new gear - jealous I wasn't able to make it https://www.northernjacks.com/post/the-opeongo-shuffle Cheers Andrew

Well.......................I did the freeze-dried meals thing a lot when I was hiking and canoe camping forty or so years ago.Â  Maybe the meals are better now (and almost certainly this is true), BUT!!!!!Â  I will happily walk more loaded miles to eat real food, even if it means doubling a 2 km portage! Doug

Doug I know the guys made the meals themselves this time and by all accounts they were great. Â  I have found that we are starting to gravitate towards easier meals for our trips as opposed to decadent. Â  We just had a planning chat for our fly in next summer and a few of our more complicated meals got gassed for easier but hardy ones. Â Re no smoker ribs this time instead a good pre made chili Â  Â Less time cooking and more time fishing and beers at the fore I guess lol Cheers Andrew

Thanks Andrew, for adding to my education.Â  I did not know that a person could freeze-dry their own food.Â  I still don't think I would go back to that kind of meals, but home-made is going to be better than dried cardboard in a foil pouch.............just add water and grumble.........ğŸ™„
No worries. Â Yeah I think home dehydrated food is the â€œnew thingâ€. Â Dehydrators are relatively cheap, you control what your eating and the ore bought meals are not cheap Andrew
